metadata.title: CVE-2019-8383 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description: An issue was discovered in AdvanceCOMP through 2.1. An invalid memoryaddress occurs in the function adv_png_unfilter_8 in lib/png.c. It can betriggered by sending a crafted file to a binary. It allows an attacker tocause a Denial of Service (Segmentation fault) or possibly have unspecifiedother impact when a victim opens a specially crafted file.

criterions.comment: advancecomp: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
